Despite the common surname, Lily MacDougall (Lea Thompson) and Conor MacDougall (Steven Brand) do not know - I mean, did not know until the chance, or fate, that one way they met.
In common, Lily and Conor are single parents who raise their children alone in the best way possible. The two families have their paths crossed during a trip to Scotland, where they will participate in a traditional local game involving families descended from the region. Because of the same surname, Lily, Conor and their flocks are placed in the same chalet - hotel reservations confused and thought they were repeated, canceling one.
Forced to live together during the game, the two families are also required to participate in the competition as if they were one. And to win, they have to know themselves better and learn to work together. With each passing day - and after much confusion - something new arises between Lily and Conor and can change their lives forever!
